claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Karl Marx  (  -LSB- mɑrks -RSB- -LSB- ˈkaɐ̯l ˈmaɐ̯ks -RSB- ; 5 May 1818 -- 14 March 1883  )  was a Prussian-born philosopher , economist , sociologist , journalist , and revolutionary socialist .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Born in Trier to a middle-class family , he later studied political economy and Hegelian philosophy .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: As an adult , Marx became stateless and spent much of his life in London , England , where he continued to develop his thought in collaboration with German thinker Friedrich Engels and published various works , the most well-known being the 1848 pamphlet The Communist Manifesto .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His work has since influenced subsequent intellectual , economic , and political history .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Marx 's theories about society , economics , and politics -- collectively understood as Marxism -- hold that human societies develop through class struggle ; in capitalism , this manifests itself in the conflict between the ruling classes  (  known as the bourgeoisie  )  that control the means of production and working classes  (  known as the proletariat  )  that enable these means by selling their labour for wages .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Employing a critical approach known as historical materialism , Marx predicted that , like previous socioeconomic systems , capitalism produced internal tensions which would lead to its self-destruction and replacement by a new system : socialism .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: For Marx , class antagonisms under capitalism , owing in part to its instability and crisis-prone nature , would eventuate the working class ' development of class consciousness , leading to their conquest of political power and eventually the establishment of a classless , communist society constituted by a free association of producers .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Marx actively fought for its implementation , arguing that the working class should carry out organised revolutionary action to topple capitalism and bring about socio-economic emancipation .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Marx has been described as one of the most influential figures in human history , and his work has been both lauded and criticised .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His work in economics laid the basis for much of the current understanding of labour and its relation to capital , and subsequent economic thought .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Many intellectuals , labour unions , artists and political parties worldwide have been influenced by Marx 's work , with many modifying or adapting his ideas .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Marx is typically cited as one of the principal architects of modern social science .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The law of value  (  German : Wertgesetz  )  is a central concept in Karl Marx 's critique of political economy , first expounded in his polemic The Poverty of Philosophy  (  1847  )  against Pierre-Joseph Proudhon , with reference to David Ricardo 's economics.See Marx , The Poverty of Philosophy , chapter 1 part 2 where Marx refers to Proudhon 's own `` law of value '' and chapter 3 , titled `` Application of the Law of the Proportionality of Value '' .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In his 1857 Grundrisse manuscript , Karl Marx called the tendency of the rate of profit to fall `` the most important law of political economy '' and sought to give a causal explanation for it , in terms of his theory of capital accumulation .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Marx 's magnum opus on political economy was Das Kapital  (  Capital : A Critique of Political Economy  )  in three volumes , of which only the first volume was published in his lifetime  (  1867  )  ; the others were published by Friedrich Engels from Marx 's notes .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The tendency of the rate of profit to fall  (  TRPF  )  is a hypothesis in economics and political economy , most famously expounded by Karl Marx in chapter 13 of Capital , Volume III .

claim: Law of value is an important idea in Karl Marx's criticism of political economy.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Marxian economics or the Marxian school of economics refers to a school of economic thought tracing its foundations to the critique of classical political economy first expounded upon by Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels .
